result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez #648549 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Melvin Y Garcia-Perez #648549 was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melvin Y Garcia-Perez #648549 is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Melvin Y Garcia-Perez #648549 was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Melvin Y Garcia-Perez #648549 was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Melvin Y Garcia-Perez #648549 was found guilty of Aggravated Battery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Melvin Y Garcia-Perez #648549 was found guilty of False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Melvin Y Garcia-Perez #648549 was found guilty of Injury by Negligent Use/Weapon/Explosive, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Day two of JT.  8:37AM, Jurors enter.  State would like jurors to be allowed to review exhibits that were entered/received yesterday.  Jurors are allowed and are reviewing photos.  State calls Deputy Dan Glaze, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Witness dismissed.  Oath given to Interpreters.  State will offer a video recording, will be exhibit #14, received by the court.   9:20AM, Jurors excused to jury room.  Atty Bahnson requests a directed verdict, does not believe the State has met its burden, State asks the court to deny the motions.  Court will deny the motions.  Court addresses Mr Garcia-Perez as to testifiying.  Atty Bahnson would like to address the jury instructions.  Court will take a five minute break, 9:28 AM.  9:43 AM, Jurors return to box.  Atty Bahnson recalls Deputy Dan Glaze, direct by Atty Bahnson.  Atty Bahnson plays a video recording for the Deputy's review.  State has an objection to the video, asks for more of the video to be played.  9:50 Jurors return to box.  Atty Bahnson plays recording for the Jurors.  Exhibit number 15 entered and received.   Evidence has been closed.  Court will prepare instructions, Jurors excused to jury room @ 10:00 am. Parties address jury instructions.  Court goes over Jury instructions with counsels.  10:43 Jurors return to box, court begins jury instructions.  Jurors excused at 11:30 for lunch.  Will return at 12:30PM.  12:37 PM Jurors return to the box.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court gives final jury instructions.  Name drawn for alternate juror to be removed.  Oath given to bailiff.  Verdict sheets given to Jurors, Jurors released to jury room to render verdict @ 1:45PM. 2:02PM-Jurors have a question-would like to view pictures(exhibits will be sent in with the exception of the knife, cell phone, flashlight and recordings). Jurors have a question.  Answer provided to jurors-note written by court.  3:15 PM the Jury has reached a verdict.

Ct 2-NG
CT 3-NG

CT 8-G
Polling of all jurors, yes to all counts.  
Court thanks the jurors for their service, invites them to stay for any feedback on accomodations if they would like.  Jurors are dismissed at 3:21 PM.  
Revoke bond.  Set for sentencing after PSI has been completed.  Set for sentencing 6-28-16 @ 1:00PM for one hour.  PSI to be completed one week prior to sentencing.   Set for one hour time slot.
2/03/20 -Exhibits #8 and #9 both scanned in 2 parts. (to large to scan each as one document)
WITH EXHIBITS NUMBER ONE THRU TWELVE.  (EXHIBITS NOT SCANNED IN VAULT BY COC OFFICE)  (#7Voluntary Statement-denied) (exhibits #8 and #9 both scanned in two sections-all color photos)
Jury sign in sheet, day one
Jury seating chart

8:02 AM-Defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreters for Jury Trial are Mariana Kralewski and Maria Isabel Marin (Maribel)  , oath given to interpreters.  Witnesses will be sequestered.  Deputy Dan Glaze will be the State's Officer.  No reference to Defendant or victims, names will be used.  Atty Bahnson has additions to Jury Instructions that she would like added.  Ms Wendi Adams has had a family emergency, will not be appearing in court, her supervisor will be allowed to appear for her.  8:15AM-adjourned till 8:30AM.  Oath given to all potential jurors.  21 Jurors called to the box.  Court begins questioning of jurors.  Parties are introduced to jurors.  Jurors #113, 845, 569, 635, 17, 221, 479, 522, 459, 187, 385 all excused.  Counsel questions jurors.  Counsel approaches the bench, has concerns of one potential juror, asking for removal for cause.  10:09 AM-Counsel selects panel.  Jury selection is completed.  10:20 jurors given oath.  Jurors excused to jury room to make any necessary arrangements.  Court will resume in 20 minutes.  10:41AM, back on the record, outside the presence of the Jurors, Court addresses the motion that was heard earlier this week.  The court is satisfied that the miranda rights given the DE were fair and accurate, court will deny the motion to suppress.  10:48 AM jurors return to box.  Court begins jury instructions.  State make opening statements to the jurors.  Jurors excused at 12:05 for lunch.  Court will resume at 1:00PM.  1:02 PM jurors return to box.   Opening statements by Atty Bahnson.  State calls Julia Hoover, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Atty Bahnson.  Redirect by the State.  Witness dismissed.  State will call Julie Ann Germaine, oath given.  Direct by the State.  State enters exhibit number one, recieved by the court.  Cross by Atty Bahnson.  Exhibit number two entered by Defense, received by the court.  Redirect by the State.  Recross.  Witness dismissed. 2:03PM Jurors will take a ten minute break.  Jurors return @ 2:17PM.  State calls Caroyln Martin, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Objection. Objection, sustained.  Witness dismissed.  State calls Deputy Dan Glaze, oath given.  Direct by the State. State enters exhibits 3,4,5,6, all evidence bags opened by the witness, as directed by the court.  State enters Exhibit #7, voluntary statement of victim.  All exhibits offered to the court, exhibits 3-6 received by the court.  Objection to exhibit #7.  Cross by Atty Bahnson.  Objection, sustained.  State enters exhibit number 8,9,10, all received by the court.  Witness dismissed.  3:37 pm, 5 minute break, jurors excused to jury room.   3:48PM, State would like a stipulation by parties entered on the record concerning fingerprint expert.  3:49PM jurors return.  State enters exhibit number eleven, received.  State calls Robb Jandrt, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Atty Bahnson enters exhibit number 12, received.  Witness dismissed.  State calls Deputy Anthony Engel, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Defense.  Witness dismissed.  State calls Deputy David Fenstermacher, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Defense.  Witness dismissed.  State calls Deputy Lisa Barth, oath given.  Direct by the State.  No recross.  Witness dismissed.  The court will recess for today, will reconvene at 8:30AM friday.  Jurors excused at 4:30PM.
Defendant's Motion for Continuance, filed by Atty Bahnson

Defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson appearing telephonic.  Defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter from Swits called.  Interpreter makes contact with DE.  Interpreter oath given.  Court recites events from MH 4-4-16.  Atty Bahnson has filed a Motion to Adjourn JT scheduled for April 7/8.  The State wishes to make several clarifications on the record.  The State maintains the video recordings have been provided to defense prior, on October 15.  The court believes that since all recording were provided to defense, there should be no changes, the court will not adjourn the JT scheduled for April 7/8.  The court will review the recordings and make a ruling regarding the suppression motion prior to the start of the trial.

Defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Melvin Y Garcia-Perez in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Darius Torres in court with DE, oath given.  State calls Deputy Dan Glaze, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Atty Bahnson.  Objection, overruled.  Redirect by the State.  Objection, sustained.  Witness dismissed.  State asks for bind over.  Atty Bahnson does not believe State has presented enough evidence.  Court finds probable cause, will bind over.  Information filed by the State this day.  Set for arraignment 10-19-15 @ 1:00PM.  Interpreter scheduled this day in court.  Atty would like to address the issue of bond, asking for a $20,000.00 cash bond.  State objects.  The court will order a $100,000.00 cash bond.
